newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Strikers damage Namibia Tsumeb smelter, flood mine.
newsitem.headline: Strikers damage Namibia Tsumeb smelter, flood mine.

text.p: Gold Fields Namibia Ltd said on Monday that severe disruptions had occurred at the three operations of its subsidiary Tsumeb Corp Ltd due to strike action by the Mineworkers Union of Namibia.

"Reports indicate that strikers took control of certain key areas of the operations including the copper smelter and the entire Kombat property. Pumping at the Tsumeb, Kombat and Otjihase operations has been interrupted and water is currently flowing into the deeper levels of these mines," the company said.
Gold Fields said damage to the copper smelter and flooding of the mines were "cause for very serious concern", but it added it was not possible top quantity the consequences at this stage.

The company has obtained an urgent interim court order declaring the strike, in support of a wage demand, to be unlawful and restraining striking employees from obstructing the company's normal operations.
However, the Namibian authorities have had only limited succeess in enforcing the order.
